column4:
We are looking for a passionate and driven go-getter to join our North American team. You will be responsible for growing and maintaining the PlayerData community by generating leads and closing deals through outbound sales in the U.S.

The Role

  • Own your territory - generate new business leads and proactively identify sales opportunities within the club and youth sports market
  • Conduct thorough market research to understand customer needs, industry trends, and competitive landscape to effectively position our products and services
  • Conduct sales presentations and product demonstrations to effectively communicate the value and benefits of our solutions
  • Collaborate with internal teams, including marketing and product development, to ensure alignment of strategies and provide valuable feedback from the market
  • Develop and execute sales strategies, including prospecting, cold calling, networking, and attending industry conferences and events
  • Prepare and deliver persuasive sales proposals and negotiate contract terms to achieve sales targets and close deals
  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date sales records, activity reports, and customer information in the CRM system
  • Help strategically plan and execute on an events calendar local to your market including tournaments, camps, and other sports functions
  • Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitors' offerings to remain knowledgeable and provide valuable insights to customers
  • Be prepared to support the business in whatever way possible to help achieve company wide goals.

The Ideal Candidate

  • Background in Soccer, either as a coach or player (club, academy NCAA, Professional)
  • Proven track record of success in B2B sales, preferably within the sports industry or with a SAAS company
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively articulate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Strong networking and relationship-building skills to establish and maintain fruitful partnerships with key stakeholders
  • Results-driven mindset with a passion for meeting and exceeding sales targets and driving revenue growth
  • Self-motivated and proactive with a strong work ethic and the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment
  • Exceptional organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Proficiency in using CRM software and other sales tools to track leads, opportunities, and customer interactions.
  • Flexibility to travel as needed to attend client meetings, industry events, and conferences

Benefits

  • Health Insurance
  • 4% match on 401K
  • 15 days holidays and paid sick leave
  • Mental health support through Spill
  • Perks at work discounts on major brands

Workplace & Diversity

At PlayerData, we’re an equal opportunities employer and we believe in no judgement when it comes to anything that makes you who you are - gender, race, sexuality. religion or anything else. If you need any additional support for the interview, just let us know so we can make arrangements for you.

How to Apply

Does this role sound like a good fit? Email us at jobs@playerdata.com

  • Include the role in the subject line
  • Attach a copy of your resume
  • Send along any extra links that may be relevant to your application (we want to get to know YOU not just a list of your job history!)
PlayerData is an equal opportunity employer.
column8: California, USA; Texas, USA; Florida, USA; Remote; Philadelphia, PA, USA

column4:
We're seeking a passionate go-getter to build and lead our US Sales team responsible for generating leads and closing deals across the U.S. This person is a great leader and is not afraid to roll up their sleeves and do the work. This role will shape the future and make a lasting impact on our PlayerData community.

The Role

  • Generate new business leads and proactively identify sales opportunities within the club and youth sports market
  • Build and manage a national sales team from the ground up
  • Design systems and processes to ensure success of US sales organisation
  • Work closely with marketing team to create the most effective and optimised funnel
  • Be a part of the leadership team and work closely to evolve the go-to-market strategy to accomplish goals
  • Conduct sales presentations and product demonstrations to effectively communicate the value and benefits of our solutions
  • Develop and execute sales strategies, including prospecting, cold calling, networking, and attending industry conferences and events
  • Prepare and deliver persuasive sales proposals and negotiate contract terms to achieve sales targets and close deals
  • Maintain accurate and up-to-date sales records, activity reports, and customer information in the CRM system
  • Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitors' offerings to remain knowledgeable and provide valuable insights to customers
  • Be prepared to support the business in whatever way possible to help achieve company wide goals.

The Ideal Candidate

  • 10+ years experience in B2B sales in either SAAS or a sports technology business as a sales leader
  • Proven track record of managing high functioning teams and working in a fast paced environment
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively articulate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Strong networking and relationship-building skills to establish and maintain fruitful partnerships with key stakeholders
  • Results-driven mindset with a passion for meeting and exceeding sales targets and driving revenue growth
  • Self-motivated and proactive with a strong work ethic and the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment
  • Flexibility to travel as needed to attend client meetings, industry events, and conferences

Benefits

  • Health Insurance
  • 4% match on 401K
  • 15 days holidays and paid sick leave
  • Mental health support through Spill
  • Perks at work discounts on major brands

Workplace & Diversity

At PlayerData, we’re an equal opportunities employer and we believe in no judgement when it comes to anything that makes you who you are - gender, race, sexuality. religion or anything else. If you need any additional support for the interview, just let us know so we can make arrangements for you.

How to Apply

Does this role sound like a good fit? Email us at: jobs@playerdata.com

  • Include the role in the subject line
  • Attach a copy of your resume
  • Send along any extra links that may be relevant to your application (we want to get to know YOU not just a list of your job history!)
PlayerData is an equal opportunity employer.
